name: Keiko's Cottages & Bed & Breakfast

reviews.title: A great place to stay while visiting Milford Sound
reviews.text: We spent two nights at Keiko's Cottages as a base for our trip to Milford Sound. Within minutes of booking in our super-helpful hosts had arranged our booking for a Milford Sound cruise the next day and given us all sorts of tips about the road conditions and local things to do and see.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Future potential customers don't deserve the events of last week happening to them, hence I'm writing my first review ever:
reviews.title: Dis-respected, Unprofessional, and Lied to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a mechanical engineer, my partner is a school teacher. We had lots of email communication with the owner up to 3 weeks prior to arrival to the bed and breakfast to arrange accomodation and to act as our booking agent for 2 cruises within Fiordland...I also gave him my Gold credit card number to reserve over the phone 3 weeks in advance. We arrived at 8:30pm, a bit late, due to a full itinerary of sight seeing. It turns out, the owner took my credit card number down wrong over the phone. A simple mistake by the owner (which he fails to admit) turned into an evening of hell where he immediately told us that all of our weekend plans were cancelled and that it would be too late at that point to book anything.
reviews.title: Wonderful gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For clarification sakes, I'm complaining that the owner had 3 weeks to contact us about the mistaken credit card number, and didn't, and mis-treated both my partner and I upon arrival.
reviews.title: a wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Upon initial greeting, instead of looking for clarification and possibly reviewing the written credit card number for a mistake, he immediately mentioned how all of our weekend plans/cruises were cancelled... He did not want to figure out what had happened, but was focused on complete negativity.
reviews.title: Sweet B&B

reviews.text: We stayed with Kevin and Keiko for one night on the way to Milford. Kevin had very kindly organised our trips to the Glow worm caves ( a must see) and also our boat trip at Milford Sound.Kevin had got us the best deal too - whereby the kids went free so his advice is well worth it. Kevin knows the area well so he also gave us lot of tips and info to ensure we saw all the main sights of Milford and the surrounding area.
reviews.title: The Perfect Stop-over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a family of four with two boys aged 11 and 13 - the rooms were large, modern, immaculately clean and spacious. The beds were comfy with electric blankets and all the rooms had heaters so we didn't get cold.
reviews.title: Beautiful place to stay and enjoy the Southland
nice little place on edge of town
reviews.text: ( even in Summer the weather can be quite changeable). The highlight of our stay was the option of a full Japanese breakfast that Keiko makes herself. This is highly recommended as it is delicious and a real experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I find B&B quite expensive in NZ - so in the context of this we felt we got great value for money. We would happily stay with Kevin again.
reviews.title: Terrific accomodations and host, Kevin
Good for families with young children..

aka: Keiko's Cottages & Bed & Breakfast Te Anau, Fiordland
